headline: Church Dwight Balances New Brands Portfolio Changes And Steady Dividend Growth
summary: Church & Dwight (NYSE:CHD) has outlined a series of new product launches across THERABREATH, ARM & HAMMER, HERO, and TROJAN. They have recently completed a divestiture of non core businesses as part of a portfolio reshaping effort. Management continues its multi decade pattern of dividend increases, signaling an ongoing focus on shareholder returns. Church & Dwight operates in the branded consumer products space, with a mix of household, personal care, and specialty products that tend to...

headline: How Investors Are Reacting To Church & Dwight (CHD) Mixed Quarter, Higher Dividend And 2026 Outlook
summary: Church & Dwight Co., Inc. reported past fourth-quarter 2025 sales of US$1,644.2 million, up from US$1,582.0 million a year earlier, while quarterly net income fell to US$143.5 million even as full-year 2025 net income rose to US$736.8 million on slightly higher annual sales of US$6,203.2 million. The company paired this mixed quarter with higher full-year earnings, a 4.2% dividend increase to US$1.23 per share annually, updated 2026 guidance, ongoing share repurchases, and an innovation...
